questions.question: The Constitution states that all revenue bills must originate in

choices.answer: the Congressional Budget Office
the United States Senate
the Office of Management and Budget
the United States House of Representatives

imageMetadata.altText: Beautiful luxury home exterior on bright sunny day with green grass and blue sky

questions.question: When a bill passes the House and the Senate in different versions, the bill is resolved by which of the following types

choices.answer: Conference
Select
Rules
Standing

imageMetadata.altText: Millennial black businesswoman addressing colleagues at a corporate business meeting, close up

questions.question: Congressional legislative powers include all of the following EXCEPT

choices.answer: legislating federal appropriations
pardoning felons
passing federal laws
approval of treaties

questions.question: Which of the following statements about motions for cloture is true?

choices.answer: They force a bill out of committee so that the full House can vote on it.
They are applied to bills that failed in the previous session of Congress.
They are used by senators to end a filibuster and bring a bill to a vote.
They occur whenever a bill is reported out of committee.

imageMetadata.altText: Stop Sign With Blue Sky Background and Copy Space

questions.question: Members of Congress who have adopted the delegate role of representation normally cast their votes based on:

choices.answer: The preferences of the majority of their constituents.
Their judgment of what is best for their constituency.
The instructions of their political party’s leadership.
The advice of congressional staffers and political consultants.

questions.question: The United States Constitution says that Congress has the power to coin money. This is an example of:

choices.answer: an implied power.
an enumerated power.
a reserved power.
a concurrent power.

questions.question: Which of the following statements accurately summarizes the reasoning for the decision in Baker v. Carr (1962) ?

choices.answer: Rural districts had fewer people so representation is unevenly distributed.
There should be an equal number of rural and urban districts in a state.
States can choose not to redistrict at their levels every 10 years.
It must involve traditionally excluded groups in the process.

imageMetadata.altText: US Supreme Court Building Detail Close-Up

questions.question: The boundary lines of congressional districts are drawn by:

choices.answer: the United States House of Representatives.
state governors.
The United States Senate.
state legislatures.

imageMetadata.altText: Welcome to Florida sign with palm trees in background

questions.question: A committee chair in the House of Representatives is always

choices.answer: a trusted ally of the President.
the member with the longest service in the House.
a member of the majority party in the chamber.
the member with the longest service on the committee.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most likely consequence of divided government?

choices.answer: Reorganization of the federal bureaucracy.
Delays in confirmation of federal court nominees.
Conflicts between national government and states.
Elimination of the seniority rule in Congress.

imageMetadata.altText: President Trump Announces His Supreme Court Nominee To Replace Justice Ginsburg

questions.question: Much of the steady increase in federal government expenditures since 1960 has been caused by

choices.answer: increases in entitlement programs.
increased purchases of US government securities by foreign investors.
higher interest rates caused by an increase in the discount rate
the growth of the United States trade imbalance.

questions.question: Enumerated powers of the federal government include all of the following EXCEPT the power to

choices.answer: declare war.
regulate interstate commerce.
tax.
regulate intrastate commerce.

questions.question: Which of the following identifies the formal procedure for ending a filibuster?

choices.answer: Oversight
Logrolling
Cloture
Discharge petition

imageMetadata.altText: Hand turns a dice and changes the expression "Done?" to "Done!".

questions.question: Establishing the boundaries of US congressional districts to give 1 party an advantage over another is referred to as

choices.answer: reapportionment.
apportionment.
gerrymandering.
filibustering.

questions.question: Elections for the House of Representatives provide

choices.answer: an equal chance of getting elected for both incumbents and challengers.
approximately equal representation for every voter.
proportion representation based on the percent of votes cast for the party.
proportional representation of racial and ethnic minorities.

imageMetadata.altText: woman shows notepad with the text we are equal

questions.question: The advantages of incumbency in congressional elections include which of the following?

choices.answer: Most American voters believe Congress does a good job.
Incumbents receive more campaign contributions than do challengers.
The government provides campaign funds for incumbents.
Incumbents are able to provide important services for individual voters.

imageMetadata.altText: Portrait of her she nice attractive cheerful cheery positive trendy luxury wavy-haired lady throwing 100 hundred million expenses isolated over bright vivid shine violet lilac background

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding the leadership structure of Congress?

choices.answer: Vice president is responsible for creating and setting legislative agenda.
The minority leader in House/Senate is to strategize for minority party.
Speaker of the House has little power to control majority party members.
The majority leaders in both chambers work to ensure a bipartisan agenda.

imageMetadata.altText: American flag waving with the Capitol Hill

questions.question: The committee system is more important in the House than in the Senate because

choices.answer: Constitution mandates the type of committee structure in the House.
Committee members are appointed by the President.
House is so large more work can be done in committees than on the floor.
Majority party in House prefers to give priority to work of the committees.

imageMetadata.altText: Stack of hands. Unity and teamwork concept.
